question.title: How can I retrieve list of values from database within a "useTransaction" lambda expression?
question.body:
What I would like to do is the following:

    private List<Integer> getIds(Jdbi jdbi) {
        List<Integer> ids = new ArrayList<>();
        
        jdbi.useTransaction(handle -> {
            ids = handle.createQuery("select distinct id from table_x where status = 12")
                    .mapTo(Integer.class)
                    .list();
        });

        return ids;
    }

However, this is not allowed (ids need to be final or effectively final.)

The following code was suggested by my IDE:

    private List<Integer> getIds2(Jdbi jdbi) {
        AtomicReference<List<Integer>> result = new AtomicReference<>(new ArrayList<>());
        jdbi.useTransaction(handle -> {
            List<Integer> ids = handle.createQuery("select distinct id from table_x where status = 12")
                    .mapTo(Integer.class)
                    .list();
            result.set(ids);
        });

        return result.get();
    }

Isn't there an easier way to retrieve a list of values from the database?

answers.body:
Use the Jdbi::inTransaction(HandleCallback) method if you want to return something from the transaction:

public <R,X extends Exception> R inTransaction(HandleCallback<R,X> callback) 
                                        throws X

A convenience function which manages the lifecycle of a handle and yields it to a callback for use by clients. The handle will be in a transaction when the callback is invoked, and that transaction will be committed if the callback finishes normally, or rolled back if the callback raises an exception.

Type Parameters:

R - type returned by the callback

X - exception type thrown by the callback, if any.

Parameters:

callback - A callback which will receive an open Handle, in a transaction

Returns:

the value returned by callback

Throws:

X - any exception thrown by the callback

Example using your code:

private List<Integer> getIds2(Jdbi jdbi) {
  return jdbi.inTransaction(handle -> handle
      .createQuery("select distinct id from table_x where status = 12")
      .mapTo(Integer.class)
      .list());
}

question_comments.body: Thanks a lot. That was the solution I was  looking for.
